description: A Windows Server 2019 instance is unexpectedly checking in with the WSUS server for updates despite a Group Policy Object (GPO) that is configured to disable automatic updates. The server is managed under a specific GPO aimed at optimizing the use of a patching solution (Syxsense) and is expected to rely solely on this server for manual update checks. However, the server checks into WSUS at an unusual time (11:01 PM) while the configurations should ideally prevent such behavior. Registry settings confirm that automatic updates are disabled, yet this behavior indicates potential misconfiguration or other underlying issues in the patch management setup. System administrators need to explore further into potential conflicting policies or unexpected task scheduler entries that could trigger this behavior.
